intro: Arabis cebennensis, commonly known as the Cebennian rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants known for their cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Arabis cebennensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to flourish in challenging, high-altitude habitats.
